column4: I keep getting this xsession error, and when I press OK, my x will restart and reprocude the error. Someone knows a way out? :S (im now upgrading to gutsy, see if that fixes it)

I have a problem with my Xorg. When I log in, it gives an error that the previous session lasted less than 10 seconds. When I press ok, it will restart, and give the same error. Any suggestions?
I have a problem with my Xorg. When I log in, it gives an error that the previous session lasted less than 10 seconds. When I press ok, it will restart, and give the same error. Any suggestions?
I have a problem with my Xorg. When I log in, it gives an error that the previous session lasted less than 10 seconds. When I press ok, it will restart, and give the same error. Any suggestions?
gutsy doesn't have a new xorg yet, and it will break much more then just xorg if you don't watch out.
I know
when you log in? Are you having xorg problems, or gnome problems?
only xorg problems. It produces an error report but I cant get wise out of that one, I checked every error, wait ill pastebin it
here is the error report http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/18280/
sry, no idea at all.
try the forums, has a larger user base.
ok will do.
doesn't seem like a xorg crash though, I think gnome is just acting up. renaming the gnome dirs in you home directory might straighten that out.
its worth a try, how do I do that?
log into a shell. cntr-alt-f5 or something. then rename .gnome and .gnome2 folders
I say rename because it's the same as deleting them without actually losing the option to place it back when it has no effect.
thanks a LOT man! :)
yeah, I figured it was a gnome error and that usually works then. All gnome settings are lost though... I don't know what exactly caused the problem.

I dont have any custom gnome settings or whatsoever, only my session is lost. And I think I know the problem; I sometimes use 'Inhibernate' as a shutdown option, but last time it failed, and then all this came ;)
